snippet: A movement in Egypt illustrates the greatest strengths and the most glaring weaknesses of the youth groups that have driven many of Egypt’s most fundamental political transformations.
abstract: Hugely popular movement to oust Egypt's Pres Mohamed Morsi, called tamarrod, which has rallied millions of Egyptians to join protests and shaken Morsi's grip on power, illustrates the greatest strengths and glaring weakness of Egypt's powerful political youth; groups are good at channeling public sentiment but often fail to transform it into sustainable organizations.
lead_paragraph: A movement in Egypt illustrates the greatest strengths and the most glaring weaknesses of the youth groups that have driven many of Egypt’s most fundamental political transformations.

headline.main: Young Activists Rouse Egypt Protests but Leave Next Steps to Public
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Young Activists Rouse Protests, but Leave Next Steps in Hands of Public

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
